page.title: 10WESTBERE
page.content: This is a "residentially desiralble", typically pretty Kent dormitory village, with strong local desire to conserve traditional buildings.Westbere is bordered by the railway line and the Island Rd.(A28), both offering direct access to Thanet(N.E.Kent) it is a picturesque backwater & has an interesting timber-framed pub Ye Old Yew Tree(1308) the social focus of the village & attracts outside visitors There is no commercial development the nearset shops are 1 mile away in Sturry, which makes difficulties for older residents.There are 2 public telephones, at either end of the village & 2 post boxes with 2 daily collections.Building is carefully regulated,some "period" agric. buildings have been converted for middle-class use, while a complex of modern bungalows was kept well away
